title: Data Science Homework Intro
text:
Being a data scientist is about being able to understand and manipulate data while also being able to effectively communicate the story it’s telling
Data scientists and statisticians are similar …
My background is in statistics but I am currently perusing a career path in data science…

title: Data Science Homework Intro
text:
R Code:
This code saves an object as ‘y’ that reports the density of the petal.width column on the iris data set:

y <- density(iris$Petal.Width)
y


Call:
    density.default(x = iris$Petal.Width)

Data: iris$Petal.Width (150 obs.);  Bandwidth 'bw' = 0.2518

       x                 y            
 Min.   :-0.6555   Min.   :0.0005272  
 1st Qu.: 0.3222   1st Qu.:0.0832811  
 Median : 1.3000   Median :0.2653324  
 Mean   : 1.3000   Mean   :0.2554014  
 3rd Qu.: 2.2778   3rd Qu.:0.4193541  
 Max.   : 3.2555   Max.   :0.4978541  


The following code reports the class, type and structure of y:

class(y)

[1] "density"

typeof(y)

[1] "list"

str(y)

List of 7
 $ x        : num [1:512] -0.656 -0.648 -0.64 -0.633 -0.625 ...
 $ y        : num [1:512] 0.00163 0.0018 0.00199 0.00219 0.00241 ...
 $ bw       : num 0.252
 $ n        : int 150
 $ call     : language density.default(x = iris$Petal.Width)
 $ data.name: chr "iris$Petal.Width"
 $ has.na   : logi FALSE
 - attr(*, "class")= chr "density"
